valueProposition.title: Grid Feasibility and Investment Decision Discipline
valueProposition.body: In Romania’s renewable energy market, project value is primarily determined by the alignment between a paper design and actual grid capacity. While many market practices focus on development optics, AFA applies investor- and financing-grade technical filters. Grid conditions and connection cost scope encountered at or after the Technical Connection Approval (Aviz Tehnic de Racordare – ATR) can directly impact project economics. Therefore, our assessment is not limited to permit status; it is anchored to thresholds for evacuation capability, deliverability, and bankability. We do not assume the role of developer or EPC contractor, enabling independent verification without conflicts of interest.

framework.title: Capacity and Grid Integration
framework.description: Connection point occupancy analysis and evacuation capability stress testing. Validation of curtailment projections.

framework.title: Regulatory and Permit Validity
framework.description: Compliance review of ATR and related permits against ANRE requirements and validity periods.

framework.title: CAPEX and Connection Economics
framework.description: Verification of connection cost scope and rationalization of the investment budget.

framework.title: Bankability and Data Integrity
framework.description: Mapping technical findings against bankability thresholds.
